results.title: Cromwell
results.creator_credit: Ken Hughes, Irving Allen and Columbia
results.brief_description: The last flourish of the decadent Cavaliers, the obdurate zeal of the insurgent Puritans, the mighty clashes in Parliament and on the battlefields, the king’s death on the headsman’s block - a crucial phase of British history is encompassed in “Cromewell”. This powerful story unfolds majestically against a backdrop of pageant, bloody battle and the agonies of a country torn by civil war. Stars Alec Guinness as Charles I and Richard Harris as Oliver Cromwell with a distinguished supporting cast.

results.title: Crocodile Dundee in Los Angeles
results.creator_credit: Simon Wincer, Paul Hogan, Lance Hool, Bungalow Films, Silver Lion Films and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: In the third instalment in the Crocodile Dundee series, Paul Hogan reprises the titular character of Mick Crocodile Dundee, only this time the principal action takes place in Los Angeles. Mick is living in Walkabout Creek with his wife Sue and son, when Sue is recalled to Los Angeles to take over her father’s newspaper. As there is an embargo on crocodile shooting, Mick decides it would be for the best if the entire family relocate to LA for a spell. Once in LA, Mick lands a role as an extra in a film, gets a job handling animals on set, goes about solving a murder mystery and uncovers some illegal dealings in the movie business. Mick is typically chaotic with his misunderstandings of the cultural nuances of LA, holding up a freeway in order to catch a skunk and foiling muggers with his bush skills. “Crocodile Dundee in Los Angeles” is a fish out of water comedy that relies on reviving the successful jokes of its predecessors in the series. Like the other Crocodile Dundee films, this one panders to gross Australian stereotypes as a formula for comedy. With cameos from Mike Tyson and George Hamilton.

results.title: Crocodile Dundee II. (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: John Cornell, Jane Scott and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Begins in New York where Dundee now lives with his journalist girlfriend. In order to escape the pursuit of an international drug ring who have murdered her former husband, Dundee and his girlfriend return to the Australian outback where Dundee is well prepared to confront them.

results.title: Crazy in Alabama
results.creator_credit: Antonio Banderas, Linda Goldstein Knowlton, Meir Teper and Green Moon Productions
results.brief_description: The events which unfold during the summer of 1965 prove to be a turning point in the life of 13-year-old Peejoe (Lucas Black). His simple existence is turned upside down by his Aunt Lucille (Melanie Griffith), who calmly confesses to the murder of her abusive husband then hops into her car and heads for Hollywood, determined to pursue her dream of becoming an actress. Peejoe and his brother are sent to stay with uncle Dove (David Morse), a funeral director in the small town where the boys first truly experience the division between the white and black communities. The tension caused by this situation erupts when Peejoe witnesses the racist Sheriff Doggett (Meat Loaf Aday) cause the death of a young black boy during a protest over racial segregation at the local pool. The theme of madness constantly surfaces in the narrative, with the more bizarre aspects of Lucille’s adventure juxtaposed against the irrationality of the segregation laws operating in the town at the time. The plot reaches a climax when these two types of madness collide, forcing the town to confront the darker side of human nature and examine the true meaning of insanity. “Crazy in Alabama” is the directorial debut of actor Antonio Banderas, most recognised for his appearances in the early films of Pedro Almodovar, and his more recent work in Hollywood.

results.title: Crocodile Dundee (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Peter Fairman, John Cornell, Rimfire Films, Hoyts and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: A New York reporter is intrigued by stories of an Australian crocodile hunter (Paul Hogan) and accompanies him on a journey through the bush. She entices him back to Manhattan, where his very outback Australian approach to the dangers of a big city, make him a success in New York society.

results.title: Crocodile Dundee
results.creator_credit: Peter Faiman, John Cornell, Rimfire Films, Hoyts and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: A New York reporter is intrigued by stories of an Australian crocodile hunter, Mick ‘Crocodile’ Dundee, and accompanies him on a journey through the bush. She entices him back to Manhattan where his easy-going approach to the dangers of life in a big city make him a success in New York society. Stars Paul Hogan and Linda Kozlowski.

results.title: Crimes of passion
results.creator_credit: Ken Russell, Donald P. Borchers, Barry Sandler and New World Pictures
results.brief_description: Kathleen Turner leads a double life in this film by Ken Russell. By day she is Joanna, a sportswear designer, but by night she transforms herself to China-Blue, a hooker servicing a variety of sexual fantasies. Among her regular clients is a sinister preacher (Anthony Perkins) who carries his obsession with China-Blue to a chilling extreme.

results.title: Crimes and misdemeanors
results.creator_credit: Woody Allen, Robert Greenhut and Orion Pictures Corporation
results.brief_description: Beginning with small betrayals, infidelity, lies… and ending in murder; this is a bold and unflinching expose on the choices people make. Martin Landau is a respected, wealthy doctor whose world begins to crumble around him when his mistress (Anjelica Huston) threatens him with blackmail. Desperate, he must decide whether he can face getting rid of her - permanently! As a balance to this chilling tragedy, Woody Allen stars as an insecure documentary filmmaker about to tackle the hardest job of his life - filming a glowing tribute to the man he hates most in the world - his brother-in-law, played by Alan Alda. Also stars Caroline Aaron, Joanna Gleason, Claire Bloom, Jenny Nichols, Mia Farrow, Jerry Orbach and Sam Waterston.

results.title: Crime and punishment
results.brief_description: Directed by Josef Von Sternberg this is the first English language version of Dostoyevsky’s novel of obsession, murder and guilt. Peter Lorre stars as the criminology student turned murderer and Edward Arnold as the detective who breaks him. This is an example of Hollywood tackling the great Russian epic and achieving it with style.

results.title: Cries from the deep
results.creator_credit: Jacques Gagne, Jean-Michel Cousteau, Jacques-Yves Cousteau, Jacques Bobet, Cousteau Society and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The first of a two-part series, this film records the journey undertaken by marine explorer Jacques-Yves Cousteau, his 24-member team, and a Natianal Film Board of Canada crew. Working from the ‘Calypso’, a converted minesweeper transformed into a sophisticated oceanographic vessel, the team uses a helicopter, a diving saucer, inflatable boats and scuba diving equipment to explore the Grand Banks of Newfoundland, one of the world’s richest fishing areas. They discover shipwrecks, film icebergs, visit wildlife sanctuaries, where man is still an alien presence, and observe such endangered species as the beluga whale, humpback whale and harp seal. There is a fasscinating sequence showing ‘Calypso’ divers freeing a calf whale entrapped in a fishing net.
